column5: Hey guys , I picked up a 2017 1650 Lund Rebel this week ,  boat is like new and id like to keep it like that . Any recomendations on products for hull care and the vinyl protection . Thanks for any feedback , R

To get skung off of the hull I use Lysol toilet bowl cleaner, the gel type, not foam. I buy it at the Dollar Store for a few bucks. Wet the hull spray on the Lysol and give it a scrub. I tried every concoction to get the Lake Erie skung off and strait Lysol works best. Armour All for all vinyl. Spray 9 for any mildew build up before Armour All. My interior seats on my 94' StarCraft is white and it's still white.
50% of white vinegar and 50% of water works well for me to clean hull and motor.
Atinsco makes some excellent products, their Power 1 hull cleaner is an amazing cleaner. https://www.atinsco.com/products.htm  Cheers

My father in law asked a tech at a Marina/boat repair shop after his boat got messed up from dock rash what he used to get any hard water off of it, CLR diluted with water is what he was told. I recently bought a 16' side console myself and it had pretty good buildup on the hull. I used ¾ water to ¼ CLR and sprayed it on, everything came off great with a little soft scouring pad scrub
Keep it in the garage! Keep it dry! (when you're not fishing that is!)
Nice to hear from ya Ry. Hope all is well . Nice rig.  I just put the toon in,let the waves washer up,then follow same every weekend.

Hey Johnny, you used Lysol on an aluminum boat?? I know it works great on white gelcoat glass boats but I’d worry about aluminum. Not sure the paint or decals would stand up to the strength of toilet bowl cleaners. I could be 100% wrong though too!
I've used it for 10 years my Peach King friend, no problems. It's what my marina guys use.
I have used  Catain Phab on my rebel for years
Cool! Thanks pal. Good to know. ?
Thanks guys , Garage kept ,  and for now just washed with a mild marine soap, purchased at the local marina. cheers , Ry
